14#ifndef ISC_UTIL_H
15#define ISC_UTIL_H 1
16
17/*! \file isc/util.h
18 * NOTE:
19 *
20 * This file is not to be included from any <isc/???.h> (or other) library
21 * files.
22 *
23 * \brief
24 * Including this file puts several macros in your name space that are
25 * not protected (as all the other ISC functions/macros do) by prepending
26 * ISC_ or isc_ to the name.
27 */
28
29/***
30 *** General Macros.
31 ***/
32
33/*%
34 * Use this to hide unused function arguments.
35 * \code
36 * int
37 * foo(char *bar)
38 * {
39 * UNUSED(bar);
40 * }
41 * \endcode
42 */
43#define UNUSED(x) (void)(x)
44
45/*%
46 * The opposite: silent warnings about stored values which are never read.
47 */
48#define POST(x) (void)(x)
49
50#define ISC_MAX(a, b) ((a) > (b) ? (a) : (b))
51#define ISC_MIN(a, b) ((a) < (b) ? (a) : (b))
52
53#define ISC_CLAMP(v, x, y) ((v) < (x) ? (x) : ((v) > (y) ? (y) : (v)))
54
55/*%
56 * Use this to remove the const qualifier of a variable to assign it to
57 * a non-const variable or pass it as a non-const function argument ...
58 * but only when you are sure it won't then be changed!
59 * This is necessary to sometimes shut up some compilers
60 * (as with gcc -Wcast-qual) when there is just no other good way to avoid the
61 * situation.
62 */
63#define DE_CONST(konst, var) \
64 do { \
65 union { const void *k; void *v; } _u; \
66 _u.k = konst; \
67 var = _u.v; \
68 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
69
70/*%
71 * Use this in translation units that would otherwise be empty, to
72 * suppress compiler warnings.
73 */
74#define EMPTY_TRANSLATION_UNIT extern int isc__empty;
75
76/*%
77 * We use macros instead of calling the routines directly because
78 * the capital letters make the locking stand out.
79 * We RUNTIME_CHECK for success since in general there's no way
80 * for us to continue if they fail.
81 */
82
83#ifdef ISC_UTIL_TRACEON
84#define ISC_UTIL_TRACE(a) a
85#include <stdio.h> /* Required for fprintf/stderr when tracing. */
86#else
87#define ISC_UTIL_TRACE(a)
88#endif
89
90#include <isc/result.h> /* Contractual promise. */
91
92#define LOCK(lp) do { \
93 ISC_UTIL_TRACE(fprintf(stderr, "LOCKING %p %s %d\n", \
94 (lp), __FILE__, __LINE__)); \
95 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_mutex_lock((lp)) == ISC_R_SUCCESS); \
96 ISC_UTIL_TRACE(fprintf(stderr, "LOCKED %p %s %d\n", \
97 (lp), __FILE__, __LINE__)); \
98 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
99#define UNLOCK(lp) do { \
100 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_mutex_unlock((lp)) == ISC_R_SUCCESS); \
101 ISC_UTIL_TRACE(fprintf(stderr, "UNLOCKED %p %s %d\n", \
102 (lp), __FILE__, __LINE__)); \
103 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
104
105#define BROADCAST(cvp) do { \
106 ISC_UTIL_TRACE(fprintf(stderr, "BROADCAST %p %s %d\n", \
107 (cvp), __FILE__, __LINE__)); \
108 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_condition_broadcast((cvp)) == ISC_R_SUCCESS); \
109 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
110#define SIGNAL(cvp) do { \
111 ISC_UTIL_TRACE(fprintf(stderr, "SIGNAL %p %s %d\n", \
112 (cvp), __FILE__, __LINE__)); \
113 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_condition_signal((cvp)) == ISC_R_SUCCESS); \
114 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
115#define WAIT(cvp, lp) do { \
116 ISC_UTIL_TRACE(fprintf(stderr, "WAIT %p LOCK %p %s %d\n", \
117 (cvp), \
118 (lp), __FILE__, __LINE__)); \
119 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_condition_wait((cvp), (lp)) == ISC_R_SUCCESS); \
120 ISC_UTIL_TRACE(fprintf(stderr, "WAITED %p LOCKED %p %s %d\n", \
121 (cvp), \
122 (lp), __FILE__, __LINE__)); \
123 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
124
125/*
126 * isc_condition_waituntil can return ISC_R_TIMEDOUT, so we
127 * don't RUNTIME_CHECK the result.
128 *
129 * XXX Also, can't really debug this then...
130 */
131
132#define WAITUNTIL(cvp, lp, tp) \
133 isc_condition_waituntil((cvp), (lp), (tp))
134
135#define RWLOCK(lp, t) do { \
136 ISC_UTIL_TRACE(fprintf(stderr, "RWLOCK %p, %d %s %d\n", \
137 (lp), (t), __FILE__, __LINE__)); \
138 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_rwlock_lock((lp), (t)) == ISC_R_SUCCESS); \
139 ISC_UTIL_TRACE(fprintf(stderr, "RWLOCKED %p, %d %s %d\n", \
140 (lp), (t), __FILE__, __LINE__)); \
141 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
142#define RWUNLOCK(lp, t) do { \
143 ISC_UTIL_TRACE(fprintf(stderr, "RWUNLOCK %p, %d %s %d\n", \
144 (lp), (t), __FILE__, __LINE__)); \
145 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_rwlock_unlock((lp), (t)) == ISC_R_SUCCESS); \
146 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
147
148/*
149 * List Macros.
150 */
151#include <isc/list.h> /* Contractual promise. */
152
153#define LIST(type) ISC_LIST(type)
154#define INIT_LIST(type) ISC_LIST_INIT(type)
155#define LINK(type) ISC_LINK(type)
156#define INIT_LINK(elt, link) ISC_LINK_INIT(elt, link)
157#define HEAD(list) ISC_LIST_HEAD(list)
158#define TAIL(list) ISC_LIST_TAIL(list)
159#define EMPTY(list) ISC_LIST_EMPTY(list)
160#define PREV(elt, link) ISC_LIST_PREV(elt, link)
161#define NEXT(elt, link) ISC_LIST_NEXT(elt, link)
162#define APPEND(list, elt, link) ISC_LIST_APPEND(list, elt, link)
163#define PREPEND(list, elt, link) ISC_LIST_PREPEND(list, elt, link)
164#define UNLINK(list, elt, link) ISC_LIST_UNLINK(list, elt, link)
165#define ENQUEUE(list, elt, link) ISC_LIST_APPEND(list, elt, link)
166#define DEQUEUE(list, elt, link) ISC_LIST_UNLINK(list, elt, link)
167#define INSERTBEFORE(li, b, e, ln) ISC_LIST_INSERTBEFORE(li, b, e, ln)
168#define INSERTAFTER(li, a, e, ln) ISC_LIST_INSERTAFTER(li, a, e, ln)
169#define APPENDLIST(list1, list2, link) ISC_LIST_APPENDLIST(list1, list2, link)
170
171/*%
172 * Performance
173 */
174#include <isc/likely.h>
175
176#ifdef HAVE_BUILTIN_UNREACHABLE
177#define ISC_UNREACHABLE() __builtin_unreachable();
178#else
179#define ISC_UNREACHABLE()
180#endif
181
182#if !defined(__has_feature)
183#define __has_feature(x) 0
184#endif
185
186/* GCC defines __SANITIZE_ADDRESS__, so reuse the macro for clang */
187#if __has_feature(address_sanitizer)
188#define __SANITIZE_ADDRESS__ 1
189#endif
190
191#if __GNUC__ > 4 || (__GNUC__ == 4 && __GNUC_MINOR >= 6)
192#define STATIC_ASSERT(cond, msg) _Static_assert(cond, msg)
193#elif __has_feature(c_static_assert)
194#define STATIC_ASSERT(cond, msg) _Static_assert(cond, msg)
195#else
196#define STATIC_ASSERT(cond, msg) INSIST(cond)
197#endif
198
199#ifdef UNIT_TESTING
200extern void mock_assert(const int result, const char* const expression,
201 const char * const file, const int line);
202/*
203 * Allow clang to determine that the following code is not reached
204 * by calling abort() if the condition fails. The abort() will
205 * never be executed as mock_assert() and _assert_true() longjmp
206 * or exit if the condition is false.
207 */
208#define REQUIRE(expression) \
209 ((!(expression)) ? \
210 (mock_assert(0, #expression, __FILE__, __LINE__), abort()) : (void)0)
211#define ENSURE(expression) \
212 ((!(int)(expression)) ? \
213 (mock_assert(0, #expression, __FILE__, __LINE__), abort()) : (void)0)
214#define INSIST(expression) \
215 ((!(expression)) ? \
216 (mock_assert(0, #expression, __FILE__, __LINE__), abort()) : (void)0)
217#define INVARIANT(expression) \
218 ((!(expression)) ? \
219 (mock_assert(0, #expression, __FILE__, __LINE__), abort()) : (void)0)
220#define _assert_true(c, e, f, l) \
221 ((c) ? (void)0 : (_assert_true(0, e, f, l), abort()))
222#else /* UNIT_TESTING */
223/*
224 * Assertions
225 */
226#include <isc/assertions.h> /* Contractual promise. */
227
228/*% Require Assertion */
229#define REQUIRE(e) ISC_REQUIRE(e)
230/*% Ensure Assertion */
231#define ENSURE(e) ISC_ENSURE(e)
232/*% Insist Assertion */
233#define INSIST(e) ISC_INSIST(e)
234/*% Invariant Assertion */
235#define INVARIANT(e) ISC_INVARIANT(e)
236
237#endif /* UNIT_TESTING */
238
239/*
240 * Errors
241 */
242#include <isc/error.h> /* Contractual promise. */
243
244/*% Unexpected Error */
245#define UNEXPECTED_ERROR isc_error_unexpected
246/*% Fatal Error */
247#define FATAL_ERROR isc_error_fatal
248
249#ifdef UNIT_TESTING
250
251#define RUNTIME_CHECK(expression) \
252 mock_assert((int)(expression), #expression, __FILE__, __LINE__)
253
254#else /* UNIT_TESTING */
255
256/*% Runtime Check */
257#define RUNTIME_CHECK(cond) ISC_ERROR_RUNTIMECHECK(cond)
258
259#endif /* UNIT_TESTING */
260
261/*%
262 * Time
263 */
264#define TIME_NOW(tp) RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_time_now((tp)) == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
265
266/*%
267 * Alignment
268 */
269#define ISC_ALIGN(x, a) (((x) + (a) - 1) & ~((typeof(x))(a)-1))
270
271/*%
272 * Misc
273 */
274#include <isc/deprecated.h>
275
276#endif /* ISC_UTIL_H */
277
